meanings.definition: The act or process of remedying or correcting something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's remediation of the student's mistake helped them learn better.
meanings.sent2: The remediation of the broken bridge was completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The quick remediation of the spilled milk prevented a bigger mess.
meanings.sent4: Her remediation of the conflict between the two friends brought peace to the group.
meanings.sent5: The remediation of the leaky faucet saved gallons of water.

meanings.definition: The action of cleaning up pollution or contamination.
meanings.sent1: The company's remediation of the oil spill was praised by environmentalists.
meanings.sent2: Government agencies oversee the remediation of hazardous waste sites.
meanings.sent3: The remediation of the littered park made it a pleasant place to visit.
meanings.sent4: The remediation of the polluted river restored it to its natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: Proper remediation of the chemical spill protected the community from harm.

meanings.definition: The act of providing remedial education or training.
meanings.sent1: The school offers remediation to students who need extra help in math.
meanings.sent2: The remediation program helped the struggling students catch up with their peers.
meanings.sent3: The remediation class made learning fun and engaging for the students.
meanings.sent4: Her remediation of the reading difficulties improved the students' literacy skills.
meanings.sent5: The remediation session focused on building strong foundational knowledge.
